0.name: A Fortish Rampart
desc: "   This small embattlement is one of a great many which have been strategically placed
throughout this vast mountain range. The Forts are known for making defense a top
priority. This emphasis on security has served them well for many centuries.

2.name: A Fortish Rampart
desc: "   This small embattlement is one of a great many which have been strategically placed
throughout this vast mountain range. The Forts are known for making defense a top
priority. This emphasis on security has served them well for many centuries.

3.name: A Fortish Rampart
desc: "   The ramparts found throughout the vast mountain range provide the Forts with a
measure of security. Although an invading force may be able to easily overtake one of
these strongholds, word would quickly spread to the numerous embattlements, which
would then be easily prepared to combat the threat.

7.name: Fortish Embattlement
desc: "   If the embattlements are the first line of defense in Fortish Security, the lookout towers
essentially give them the power of clairvoyance. The Battlemasters and their soldiers would
know of any approaching threat well in advance, given the vantage point these towers have
over the mountain and valley.

8.name: Fortish Embattlement
desc: "   The Fortrum dwarves are very serious about the security of their empire. This
is one of a large number of embattlements which are scattered throughout this vast
mountain range. These fortified positions serve not only as a first line of defense
against invading forces, but also as a checkpoint to prevent against possible criminal
espionage. All visitors could be detained and searched at any given moment.

22.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north
and southeast.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other
direction.  There is a large forest to the south of the mountain range, bordering
the expansive plains to the west.  *Clunk*  A small rock falls from the mountain
side and bonks you on the head.  That wasn't very nice.  The mountain ledge seems
to go on for quite a ways.

23.name: Fortish Rampart
desc: "   The ramparts found throughout the vast mountain range provide the Forts with a
measure of security. Although an invading force may be able to easily overtake one of
these strongholds, word would quickly spread to the numerous embattlements, which
would then be easily prepared to combat the threat.

100.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue to the north, west and south.  A plush
forest of green trees lies immediately to the east.  The forest north of OldPort
is a short distance to the south from here.  You can almost see the wildlife
running through the woods.  Looking out across the expansive plains there is
nothing to see for miles.  There seems to be a mountain range in the distance
far to the northeast, but from here it just looks like small hills.  Those
mountains must be huge!  A large bison wanders into your sights.  This place
might not be so barren after all.

101.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue in every direction.  A ball of tumbleweed
rolls quickly across the rather flat landscape and knocks into your boots.  A
plush green forest surrounds the plains to the far east, south and west.  You
can see some deer running through the dense trees from here.  Looking out across
the expansive plains there is nothing to see for miles.  There may be a mountain
range to the far northeast, but it looks like small hills from here.  Those
mountains are probably huge.  A flock of birds flies out of some trees to the
south.  Something must have disturbed them.

102.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue in every direction.  You can see a large
bison walk out from behind a boulder in the distance.  It walks up to a clump
of grass and starts to graze.  There is a plush, green forest surrounding the
plains to the west, south and east.  Looking to the north, the plains seem to
out on forever.  A gust of wind sweeps across the plains causing a short sand
storm.  The land settles down very quickly as though nothing had happened.
There seems to be a soaring mountain range to the far northeast.  The mountains
clearly cover the majority of the landscape in the distance.

103.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue to the north, east and south.  A plush
forest of green trees lies immediately to the west.  The swamps of Amnos
is a short distance to the south from here.  You can almost see the wildlife
running through the cypress.  Looking out across the expansive plains there is
nothing to see for miles.  There seems to be a mountain range in the distance
far to the northeast, but from here it just looks like small hills.  Those
mountains must be huge!  A black vulture swoops down and grabs a field mouse.
This place might not be so barren after all.

104.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue to the north and east.  A plush forest of
green trees lies immediately to the west and south.  Looking out across the
expansive plains there is nothing to see for miles.  There does not even seem
to be much wildlife except for a lone vulture or field mouse.  A large yellow
sun starts to slowly set behind a mountain range to the northeast.

105.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The dust covered plains span out as far as the eyes can see.  There seems
to be little to no life roaming through the desolate landscape.  A strong wind
kicks up some dust and rock, momentarily during day into night.  The dust quickly
settles allowing for further travel through the pains.  A plush, green forest
surrounds the plains to the east, south and west.  The only obstacle to the
north appears to be a large mountain rage covering the northeast horizon.

106.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue in every direction.  There is not much
wildlife here except for a lone bison of vulture.  There must have been some
sort of water trail here before to have some bison.  The forest surrounding
the plains to the east, south and west can barely be seen from here.  It
is probably not a good idea to be so out in the open without the cover of
trees.  Fortunately, there does not appear to be any signs of danger across
the plains.  To the far northeast you can see a long mountain range running
across the horizon.  The mountains must be huge if you can see them from this
far away.

across the horizon in the distance to the north.  The plains are fairly devoid
of life except for the occasional field mouse or vulture.

207.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue to the west and north.  A plush, green
forest lies to the east and is now growing across the plains to the south.  It
is strange that you could not see this from further away.  It must be some sort
of illusion created by the merciless sun and long, hill covered plains.  The
forest seems to be teaming with life, unlike the barren plains.

208.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to run along side you to the east.  The long
and dusty plains continue to the north, west and south.  The heat on the plains is
extremely intense.  Thankfully there is some shade here from being so close to the
edge of the forest.  Looking out across the plains you can see little to no life
at all.  Even the trees are barren and wilting, almost weeping in pain.  The
forest comes to an end a little further to the north, giving way to a mighty
mountain range.  Hopefully there will be some shade from the mountains!

209.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue in every direction.  The mountain range
to the north is finally coming into full view.  It should only be a couple of
miles from here and you should be right in front of them.  The forest surrounding
the plains continue to run along side you to the east.  Barren trees grow out of
the ground every few hundred feet.  The leave less branches look like giant hands
growing out of the plains and reaching for the sky.  There is not much wildlife
to see along the plains except for a random bison or vulture here and there. Man
is it hot out here.

210.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue in every direction.  The mountain range

211.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The plush, green forest surrounding the plains seems to be fading away.  You
can see the trees coming to an end a little further to the north.  A broad
mountain range takes over for the forest to the east.  The mountains seem to take
over the entire northeast horizon.  Looking to the west, you can see that the
plains takes a turn and starts to take over the northwestern landscape.  There is
not much life to see out here in the relentless heat of the sun over head.  The
mountains to the north only seem to be a few miles further.

231.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to run along side you to the west.  The long
and dusty plains continue to the north, east and south.  The heat on the plains
is extremely intense.  Thankfully there is some shade here from being so close to
the edge of the forest.  Looking out across the plains you can see little to no
life at all.  Even the trees are barren and wilting, almost weeping in pain.  The
mountain range spanning the northeast horizon is finally coming into full view.
It is probably only a couple of miles and you would be staring straight up at them.
You can see the forest coming to an end a little further to the north.  Geez,
these plains must go on forever!

232.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains stretch out to the north, east and south.  The plush,
green forest blocks any further travel through the trees to the west.  Looking out
across the plains you can see little to no life at all.  The barren plains to the
east are covered in large stones and boulders.  They must have fallen from the top
of the mountain.  The heat on the plains is extremely intense.  Thankfully there
is some shade here from being so close to the edge of the forest.

233.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dust covered plains span out in every direction.  A large mountain
range runs across the landscape to the far northeast.  It is fairly obvious that
you will need to find a way up and around the mountain to travel any further in
that direction.  The wildlife in this section of the plains is almost non-existent.
They must be afraid of being squashed under the falling rocks and debris.  Pretty
smart animals.  Looking out into the plains, they go out for as far as the eyes can
see.  The plains seem to be heading in both the west and south direction.  Just
how big is this thing?

234.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dust covered plains span out in every direction.  A large mountain
range runs across the landscape to the far northeast.  It is fairly obvious that
you will need to find a way up and around the mountain to travel any further in
that direction.  The wildlife in this section of the plains is almost non-existent.
They must be afraid of being squashed under the falling rocks and debris.  Pretty
smart animals.  Looking out into the plains, they go out for as far as the eyes can
see.  The plains seem to be heading in both the west and south direction.  Just
how big is this thing?

235.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The rocky mountains span the northeastern section of the plains.  They do not
look very climbing friendly, but you could probably manage your way up the hazardous
mountain side.  The plains are covered with rocks and large boulders that must have
fallen from the mountain.  You definitely do not want to stand around here for
long or you might be on the wrong end of the next boulder.  Looking out across the
long and dusty plains, they appear to go on forever.  It will be quite a trek
from here to make it back to OldPort.

236.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The rocky mountains span the northeastern section of the plains.  They do not

long or you might be on the wrong end of the next boulder.  Looking out across the

239.name: At the Base of the Mountains
desc: "   The mountain side climbs high above you and into the sky.  It looks like you
might be able to climb up the mountain side at some places.  The mountain side
here looks very unstable, as though a rock slide may start at any time.  Looking
up the mountain you start to wonder if there is any end to its height.  The base
of the mountains continue to the north and south.  The hilly, rock covered plains
span out to the west and seem to go on forever.

extra.desc: "   Ouch!  A large rock falls down the mountain side and nails your head.

240.name: At the Base of the Mountains
desc: "   The mountain side climbs high above you and into the sky.  It looks like you
can actually start to ascend the mountain side from here.  The rocks look much
more stable above this spot than the rest of the mountain side base.  Looking
closely at the mountain side you can see holes and stuff marks where previous
adventurers had started their climb.  What could be on the other side of the
mountain that is so worth climbing up all that way?  The base of the mountains
continue to the north and south.  The hilly, rock covered plains span out to the
west and seem to go on forever.

extra.desc: "   Ouch!  A large rock falls down the mountain side and nails your head.

241.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The floor of the plains is littered with rocks and boulders that must have
fallen off the mountain side.  It is difficult to walk along the plains without
having to climb and negotiate your way over the jagged landscape.  Looking up
the towering mountain walls it is hard to believe there is actually a top.  They
seem to actually melt into the clouds above.  The base of the mountain lies to
the east and far north.  The hilly, rock covered plains span out into the distance
to the west and south.

257.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   A plush, green forest blocks any further travel to the north.  There is a large
mountain range spanning east from here, filling up the horizon with its jagged
peaks.  Looking out across the long and dust covered plains, it appears that the
landscape spans out for miles.  It would probably be a few days walk back to
OldPort from here.  Maybe there is another town on the other side of the mountains?
It certainly would not hurt to check it out.  Where are the plains to the west
leading to?  It is difficult to see, but it seems there is just another forest
surrounding the plains to the far west.  What could be over there?

258.name: At the Base of the Mountains
desc: "   The mountain range to the northeast is coming to an end as it greets the plush,
green forest surrounding the plains to the west.  The mountain side is much to
rigid and unsteady to be climbing up from here.  It would probably be better to
check further along the base of the mountain to the east.  Looking out around the
dusty plains you notice that plains split off into two directions, the west and
south.  This place sure is big.

259.name: At the Base of the Mountains
desc: "   The mountain side climbs high above you and into the sky.  It looks like you
might be able to climb up the mountain side at some places.  The mountain side
here looks very unstable, as though a rock slide may start at any time.  Looking
up the mountain you start to wonder if there is any end to its height.  The base
of the mountains continue to the west and east.  The hilly, rock covered plains
span out to the south and seem to go on forever.

extra.desc: " OUCH!  A large rock falls down the mountain side and nails your head.

260.name: At the Base of the Mountains
desc: "   The mountain side climbs high above you and into the sky.  It looks like you
can actually start to ascend the mountain side from here.  The rocks look much
more stable above this spot than the rest of the mountain side base.  Looking
closely at the mountain side you can see holes and stuff marks where previous
adventurers had started their climb.  What could be on the other side of the
mountain that is so worth climbing up all that way?  The base of the mountains
continue to the west and east.  The hilly, rock covered plains span out to the
south and seem to go on forever.

extra.desc: " OUCH!  A large rock falls down the mountain side and nails your head.

extra.desc: " OUCH!  A large rock falls down the mountain side and nails your head.

264.name: At the Base of the Mountains
desc: "   Towering over you like a troop of menacing warriors, the mountains forbid
any further travel to the north and east.  The hilly, rock covered plains
continue to the south and west.  Lookup up the mountain, there does not appear
to be a way up the mountain side from here.  Perhaps if you looked further along
the base of the mountains you might be able to find a way.

extra.desc: " OUCH!  A large rock falls down the mountain side and nails your head.

265.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rugged mountain side continues up and down.  There seems to be a trail to
the southeast and little further up.  The journey is steep and hazardous, better
watch your step.  Looking out across the plains to the west, you can see the land
opening up for miles.  It is probably not a good idea to jump off the mountain
from here.  The fall would be deadly to your health!

266.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rugged mountain side continues up and down.  There are plenty of hand
holds that make it easy to scale the mountain in either direction.  Unfortunately,
the mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The journey
up the mountain looks steep and hazardous, better watch your step.  Looking out
across the plains to the south, you can see the land opening up for miles.  There
does not appear to be an end to the plains from here.

267.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   Your feet instantly begin to sink into the shifting sand.  The sand's current
slowly pulls you down towards the middle of the pit.  It is difficult to see from
here but it looks like a giant set of teeth is jutting out from the sand and
biting anything it can get its mouth on.  The body of the beast remains below the
sand.  A couple of other creatures have gotten caught in the trap.  You can see
a large bear to the north of the circle and an orc very close to where the teeth
are.  You would not want to be him right now.  A plush, green forest surrounds
the sand pit.  You cannot resist the current and are drug across the sand.

268.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   Your feet instantly begin to sink into the shifting sand.  The sand's current
slowly pulls you down towards the middle of the pit.  It is difficult to see from
here but it looks like a giant set of teeth is jutting out from the sand and
biting anything it can get its mouth on.  The body of the beast remains below the

a large bear to the north of the circle and an orc very close to where the teeth
are.  You would not want to be him right now.  A plush, green forest surrounds
the sand pit.  You cannot resist the current and are drug across the sand.

269.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   You are getting way too close to the center of the sandy pit.  Unfortunately
it is too difficult to fight the current and escape this beast's trap.  The monster
is must more visible from here.  It looks like large beetle with spiked horn on
its nose.  It spears anything getting close to the center of the pit with its horn
and drags them deep into the ground.  You better work a little harder to get out
of here.

270.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   You are getting way too close to the center of the sandy pit.  Unfortunately
it is too difficult to fight the current and escape this beast's trap.  The monster
is must more visible from here.  It looks like large beetle with spiked horn on
its nose.  It spears anything getting close to the center of the pit with its horn

271.name: The Center of the Pit
desc: "   It is almost hypnotic to watch the sand swirl around the room in a clock
wise direction.  Maybe that is part of the trap to keep you calm while the worm
sets you up for the kill.  The sand beneath your feet feels very loose and your
hole body begins to sink beneath the sand.  Better keep your guard up or that
monster worm will make you its next meal.

extra.desc: "   The sand opens up and swallows you whole!

274.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   A large bear is stuck in the swirling sand.  It is moaning and struggling to
climb out, only to sink further into the sand.  Your feet continue to sink deeper
into the sand, making it impossible to help out this poor creature.  The sand's
current slowly pulls you down towards the middle of the pit.  It is difficult to
see from here but it looks like a giant set of teeth is jutting out from the sand
and biting anything it can get its mouth on.  The body of the beast remains below
the sand.  You can see an orc about to see just how powerful those teeth are as
it moves closer to the middle of the pit.

275.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   Your feet instantly begin to sink into the shifting sand.  The sand's current

desc: "   Your feet instantly begin to sink into the shifting sand.  The sand's current

bear fights for its life to the east but is only sinking lower into the sand.

277.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   You are getting way too close to the center of the sandy pit.  Unfortunately
it is too difficult to fight the current and escape this beast's trap.  The monster

desc: "   You are getting way too close to the center of the sandy pit.  Unfortunately

279.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   You are getting way too close to the center of the sandy pit.  A large orc
is struggling for his life a little further to the north.  The large beetle in
middle of the trap jumps out in excitement.  The monster knows that the orc is
never going to be able to escape.  Unfortunately for you it does not appear the
you will be getting out either as you shift closer and closer to the center of
the pit.  You better work a little harder to get out of here.

280.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   You do not need to speak orcish to understand that this poor creature is asking
for help.  It looks like he has been stuck in here for a while and is totally
exhausted.  Suddenly, a huge spiked horn erupts from the ground and pierces the
orc through his chest.  A huge horned worm slowly rises from the ground, lets out
a victory screech and pulls its fresh kill back under the sand.  It's probably not
a good idea to be hanging out around here.  On the other hand, the beetle did just
eat.  What could be in that pit?

281.name: Across the Swirling Sand
desc: "   Your feet instantly begin to sink into the shifting sand.  The sand's current

289.name: Bottom of the Pit
desc: "   The bottom of the pit is littered with the skeletons of several different
species.  You can see animal, orc, elven and even some human remnants down here.
This worm must be pretty strong to kill all these creatures.  You can see the
giant monster a little further to the south, finishing off the last of its fresh
kill.  Now would probably be a good time to run away.

290.name: Bottom of the Pit
desc: "   The bottom of the pit is littered with the skeletons of several different
species.  You can see animal, orc, elven and even some human remnants down here.
This worm must be pretty strong to kill all these creatures.  You can see the
giant monster a little further to the north, finishing off the last of its fresh
kill.  Now would probably be a good time to run away.

291.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   A plush, green forest grows all around this huge expanse of plains.  You are
still quite a distance from the forest but you can see life moving through the
trees.  It is quite a difference from the life existing on the plains.  You have
barely seen any animals out here and the remaining plant life is withered and
dying.  What could be causing this land to remain so barren with so much life
around it?

292.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The long and dusty plains continue to the east, south and west.  A plush, green
green forest blocks any further travel to the north.  A large mountain range rises
from the ground to the northeast.  There does not appear to be any end to the
mountains in sight.  Looking out across the plains there is not much to see besides
the occasional lizard or field mouse.  The plains seem to be coming to an end to
the far west.

293.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   A plush, green forest grows all around this huge expanse of plains.  You are
still quite a distance from the forest but you can see life moving through the
trees.  It is quite a difference from the life existing on the plains.  You have
barely seen any animals out here and the remaining plant life is withered and

around it?

294.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   The dust covered plains continue to the south and west.  A plush, green forest
blocks any further travel to the north and east.  You can see life moving all
throughout the forest.  It is a nice change from the almost dead plains you have
been traveling on.  If only the forest was a little less dense you could probably
explore the wilderness.  Maybe there will be a spot where you can enter the forest
further along the massive forest's edge.

300.name: On the Plains of Pharsica
desc: "   This area is surrounded by a plush, green forest.  A long mountain range lies
to the far east.  There does not appear to be any paths through the forest from
here.  The only way out appears to be back into the plains to the east.  Looking
at the landscape it is very similar to the rest of the plains, mostly devoid of
life.  The few trees that grow here have no leaves and appear to be dying.  What
a sad place.

301.name: On the Plains of Pharsica

314.name: Mountain trail near Rampart
desc: "   The rugged mountain side continues to the southeast and down.  The mountain
is impossible to climb in any other direction, the rocks are too unstable.  A
small ledge seems to have formed to the southeast.  There are footprints left
from previous adventurers.  A strong breeze runs along side of the mountain.
It almost knocks you off the mountain side, better hold on tight.  Looking down
and out across the plains, you can see all the way to the forest's edge.  The
distance to the rocky floor below is becoming quite disorienting.  It would not
be a pleasant fall from here.

315.name: Mountain trail near Rampart
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northwest
and southeast.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other
direction.  The plains below stretch out for miles.  You can see the outline
of the forest surrounding the plains in the distance to the west.  Some rock
beneath you feet starts to crumble as you put your full weight onto it.  It is
probably not a good idea to stand in any one place too long.

316.name: Mountain trail near Rampart
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northwest.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  There are scuff marks in the mountain from
the previous adventurer who climbed along the mountain side.  The rocky plains
below seem to stretch out for miles.  There is a forest surrounding the plains to
the south and in the distance to the west.  A strong breeze roars across the side
of the mountain, almost knocking you from the ledge.

317.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the southeast.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  There are scuff marks in the mountain from
the previous adventurer who climbed along the mountain side.  The rocky plains
below seem to stretch out for miles.  There is a forest surrounding the plains to
the south and in the distance to the west.  A strong breeze roars across the side
of the mountain, almost knocking you from the ledge.

318.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northwest
and southeast.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other
direction.  There is a large forest to the south of the mountain range, bordering
the expansive plains to the west.  *Clunk*  A small rock falls from the mountain
side and bonks you on the head.  That wasn't very nice.  The mountain ledge seems
to go on for quite a ways.

319.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the east and
northwest.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other direction.
There is a large forest to the south of the mountain range, bordering the expansive
plains to the west.  A strong breeze sweeps along side of the mountain, almost
knocking you off the ledge.  Better be careful.

320.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the west.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  You can see the tracks and scuff marks from
previous travellers all along the rocky trail.  The mountain side is much too
unstable to climb in any other direction.  There is a large forest lying to the
south of the mountain range, bordering the expansive, dusty plains to the west.
Some of the rock ledge begins to crumble beneath your feet as you put the full
weight of your body upon it.  It is probably not a good idea to stand around here
for too long.

321.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  You
could easily slip off and fall off the mountain side.  The forest down below just
looks like a carpet of green from here.  The trees individuality have all melded
into one giant flowing movement.  The mountain side seems to go up forever.  The
mountain's top goes straight into the clouds above.  This is going to be quite a
climb.

322.name: Mountain trail near Lookout Tower
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues to the southeast.  The mountain side can be
climbed down from here.  A strong wind sweeping along side the mountain almost
knocks you from the ledge.  The forest below is falling further and further away.
Looking up the mountain, the prospect of this journey coming to an end is not
coming to an end anytime soon anyway.  Better just keep moving.

323.name: Mountain trail near Lookout Tower
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the southeast and northwest.  The
mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  A strong wind
sweeps across the mountain, almost knocking you from the ledge.  The forest below
are so far away that the trees are just one giant mass of green, pulsating and
waving together in their lost individuality.  The mountain ledge seems to continue
for quite a ways.

324.name: Mountain trail near Lookout Tower
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues to the northwest.  The mountain side can be
climbed up from here.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  A strong wind blows across the mountain, almost knocking you from the
ledge.  The forest below is moving further and further away.  Falling from this
height would not be a great idea.  Looking up, the ragged mountain side does not
seem to come to an end.  The mountain pierces through the clouds in the sky,
hiding its peak.

325.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  You
could easily slip off and fall off the mountain side.  The forest down below just
looks like a carpet of green from here.  The trees individuality have all melded
into one giant flowing movement.  The mountain side seems to go up forever.  The
mountain's top goes straight into the clouds above.  This is going to be quite a
climb.

326.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   There is a small mountain ledge leading to the east along the mountain side.
The mountain can be climbed down from here.  There is a large mountain range
coming into view to the east.  Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice
work of bridges connecting the mountains together.  The forest below the mountain
is getting further and further away.  It would not be a pleasant fall from here.

327.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the east and west.  The mountain is too
dangerous to climb in any other direction.  There is a large mountain range coming
into view to the east.  It appears the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.
Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridge connecting the
mountains together.  The forest below the mountain is getting further and further
away.  It would not be a pleasant fall from here.

328.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the west and northeast.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  There is a large mountain range
coming into view to the east.  It appears the mountains go out for miles to the
northeast.  Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridge connecting
the mountains together.  The forest below the mountain is getting further and further
away.  It would not be a pleasant fall from here.

329.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the east and southwest.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  There is a large mountain range
coming into view to the east.  It appears the mountains go out for miles to the
northeast.  Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridge connecting
the mountains together.  The forest below the mountain is getting further and further
away.  It would not be a pleasant fall from here.

330.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the west and northeast.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open up to the north.
It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.  Looking up into
the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the mountains together.
The forest to the south of the mountain range is slowly fading into the distance.
The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain now seems to be a valley of
rock and stone.  Falling from the mountain now would surely mean certain death.

331.name: Mountain trail near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the northeast and southwest.  The
mountain is too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open
up to the north.  It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.
Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the
mountains together.  The forest to the south of the mountain range is slowly
fading into the distance.  The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain
now is a valley of rock and stone.  Falling down the mountain from here would
surely mean certain death.

332.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the southwest.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains
runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  There is a lattice work of
bridges running in between the mountains also.  There seems to be access to a
bridge a little ways up the mountain.

333.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  You
could easily slip up and fall off the mountain side with the slightest misstep.
The forest floor below is starting to look like a green, running river, heading
towards the horizon to the south.  A strong breeze whips across the mountain
side, better hold your grip a little tighter.

334.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the west.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains
runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  There is a lattice work of
bridges running in between the mountains also.  There seems to be access to a
bridge a little ways up the mountain.

335.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the east and southwest.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open up to the north.
It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.  Looking up into
the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the mountains together.
The forest to the south of the mountain range is slowly fading into the distance.
The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain now seems to be a valley of
rock and stone.  Falling from the mountain now would surely mean certain death.

336.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northeast.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  High above to the north-east you see the under-belly of a
long, sparkling bridge that looks to made of marble and is spanning an impossible
gap between a large platform and what looks like the blank walls of the city of
Fortrum.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains runs into the
horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in between the
mountains, connecting them all together.  There is a lattice work of bridges running
in between the mountains also.  There seems to be access to a bridge a little ways
up the mountain.

337.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  High
above to the north-east you see the under-belly of a long, sparkling bridge that
looks to made of marble and is spanning an impossible gap between a large platform

up and fall off the mountain side with the slightest misstep.  The forest floor

339.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northeast.  The

340.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northeast
and southwest.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  High above to the north-east you see the under-belly of a long,
sparkling bridge that looks to made of marble and is spanning an impossible gap
between a large platform and what looks like the blank walls of the city of
Fortrum.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  The view
off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of mountains fall into the
horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in between the
mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a deadly fall off of
the mountain from here.

341.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north
and southwest.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  High above to the north-east you see the under-belly of a long,
sparkling bridge that looks to made of marble and is spanning an impossible
gap between a large platform and what looks like the blank walls of the city
of Fortrum.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  The view
off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of mountains fall into the
horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in between the
mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a deadly fall off of
the mountain from here.

342.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   The mountain ledge is widening as the access to the over head bridge looms into
sight.  The rocky ledge continues to the north and south.  It is much too dangerous
to climb in any other direction.  High above to the north-east you see the under-
belly of a long, sparkling bridge that looks to made of marble and is spanning an
impossible gap between a large platform and what looks like the blank walls of the
city of Fortrum.  The valley below is getting harder to see as you journey further
up the mountain.  The view off the mountain is quite breath taking from here.  The
range of mountains fall into the horizon for quite a ways to the north.

343.name: Mountain trail near Embattlements
desc: "   The wide mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the south.  The
rope and wood bridge can be accessed with a short climb up from here.  It is much
too dangerous to climb the mountain in any other direction.  High above to the
north-east you see the under-belly of a long, sparkling bridge that looks to made
of marble and is spanning an impossible gap between a large platform and what looks
like the blank walls of the city of Fortrum.  The bridge shifts and sways slightly
in the wind.  It looks very sturdy from here.  The bridge seems to extend from this
mountain to another mountain waiting in the northeast.  What could be over there?

344.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: The mountain side has many rock holds that make it easy to climb down from
here.  There is a large door above, leading to a giant stone platform that was
built into the mountain.  Through the arches, far to the north-east, you can see
the blank walls of Fortrum and even the the massive gate of the city.  A long
rope and wood bridge extends out from the platform and seems to lead to another
large mountain lying in the northeast.  Looking off the mountain, your breath
catches in your throat as you realize just how high up you are.  The valleys below
just look like a line someone drew on a sheet of paper.  To the northwest, Fortish
arches lead to a large stone platform.

345.name: On a Large Stone Platform
desc: The large stone platform juts out very unnaturally from the mountain.  It is
very sturdy but you cannot help but feel that it will slide down the mountain at
any moment.  Far to the north-east you can see the blank walls of Fortrum and can
just make out the high and ornate gate that marks the entrance to the once closed
city.  Many bridges and platforms lay between you and the city.  A large door
below the platform leads to a trail along the mountain side.  Looking out across
a rope and wood bridge to the northeast, you can see all the way to the mountain
it connects to on the other side.  Two blazing torches line the entry way to the
bridge.  The lonely, swaying bridge is just inviting you to cross it.  To the south
west, Fortish arches lead to a mountain trail.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

346.name: Across a Swaying Rope Bridge
desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between
the mountains.  The wooden walkway creaks beneath your feet as you put your full
weight down upon it.  The bridge looks very sturdy even though it has obviously
been around for decades.  Far to the north-east you can see the blank walls of
Fortrum and can just make out the high and ornate gate that marks the entrance to
the once closed city.  Many bridges and platforms lay between you and the city.
Looking off the bridge and down into the valleys below, it is apparent that a fall
from here would be the end of your journey.  With the forceful wind blowing across
the bridge it would be a good idea to hold onto the rope handrails, they run
completely across the bridge.  A large stone platform lies to the southwest, built
into the mountain.  The rope and wood bridge continues to the northeast.

extra.desc: "   Thank goodness.  A stone platform!  That swaying was gonna make you hurl.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between
the mountains.  The wooden walkway creaks beneath your feet as you put your full

355.name: On a Large Stone Platform
desc: "   The large stone platform just out very unnaturally from the mountain.  It is
very sturdy but you cannot help but feel that it will slide down the mountain at
any moment.  This platform seems to be a halfway points between several mountains.
There is a rope and wood bridge leading to the southwest and north.  Two blazing
torches line the entry way to each of the bridges.  Far to the north, beyond a
massive platform, you can now make out the gate of fortrum coming into view.  The
criss-cross of bridges here teem with people making their way to and from the city.
The lonely, swaying bridges are just inviting you to cross them.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

356.name: Across a Swaying Rope Bridge

city.  Looking off the bridge and down into the valleys below,  it is apparent that

large mountain waiting on each side of the bridge.  It is difficult to see the
stone platforms that hold up the bridge from here.  Directly to the north you
can see the blank walls of Fotrum and its high and ornate gate.  Here and there
you can make out battlements but little else.  The platform to the north teems
with people visiting the now open city.  The long rope bridge sways back and
forth in the strong winds blowing between the mountains.  The wooden walkway
creaks beneath your feet as you put your full weight down upon it.  The bridge
looks very sturdy even though it has obviously been around for decades. Looking
off the bridge and down into the valleys below, it is apparent that a fall from
here would be the end of your journey.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

364.name: Magnificent Stone Platform
desc: You stand upon a magnificent stone platform before the gateway to the bridge
to Fortrum.  To the north a massive gate leads to a huge marble bridge that
connects this platform to the tallest mountain in the range.  Here the dwarfs
have built Fortrum, capital of the Fortish Empire.  It is surrounded by huge
walls and a massive and highly ornate gate protects the city. There are is a
rope and wood bridge leading to the west and south.  Two blazing torches line
the entry way to each of the bridges.  A large wooden door lays in the middle
of the platform.  The mountain must be able to be climbed down from there.  A
mountain road leads down off to the east.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

365.name: Across a Swaying Rope Bridge
desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between
the mountains.  The wooden walkway creaks beneath your feet as you put your full
weight down upon it.  The bridge looks very sturdy even though it has obviously
been around for decades.  Looking off the bridge and down into the valleys below,

the rope handrails, they run completely across the bridge.  A large stone
platform is built into the mountain at the end of the bridge to the east.  As you
approach the marble bridge you start get a better view of the entrance to Fortrum;
surrounded by a large wall it is mostly unadorned except for a few battlements.
But the splendid gates are a beauty to behold, even from this distance.  The
rope and wood bridge continues to the west.

extra.desc: "   Thank goodness.  A stone platform!  All that swaying was going to make you hurl.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

370.name: Across a Swaying Rope Bridge
desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between
the mountains.  The wooden walkway creaks beneath your feet as you put your full
weight down upon it.  The bridge looks very sturdy even though it has obviously
been around for decades.  You walk rope bridge with eager anticipation.  To the
north-east you can see the unadorned defensive wall around Fortrum.  You can even
make out battlements.  The bridges swarm with people, yet they barly sway.  Away
to the east the fine marble bridge spans a gap so long you can hardly believe your
eyes!  Looking off the bridge and down into the valleys below, it is apparent that
a fall from here would be the end of your journey.  With the forceful wind blowing
across the bridge it would be a good idea to hold onto the rope handrails, they run
completely across the bridge.  A large stone platform is built into the mountain at
the end of the bridge to the west.  The rope and wood bridge continues east.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between

372.name: Across a Swaying Rope Bridge
desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between
the mountains.  The wooden walkway creaks beneath your feet as you put your full
weight down upon it.  The bridge looks very sturdy even though it has obviously
been around for decades.  You walk rope bridge with eager anticipation.  To the

completely across the bridge.  A large stone platform is built into the mountain at
the end of the bridge to the west.  The rope and wood bridge continues east.

extra.desc: "   Thank goodness.  A stone platform!  All this swaying was gonna make you puke.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

373.name: On a Large Stone Platform
desc: The large stone platform juts out very unnaturally from the mountain.  It is
very sturdy but you cannot help but feel that it will slide down the mountain at
any moment.  A large door below the platform leads to a trail along the mountain
side.  Looking out across a rope and wood bridge to the east, you can see all
the way to the mountain it connects to on the other side.  You walk the rope bridge
with eager anticipation.  To the north-east you can see the unadorned defensive wall
around Fortrum.  You can even make out battlements.  The bridges swarm with people,
yet they barly sway.  Away to the east the fine marble bridge spans a gap so long
you can hardly believe your eyes!  Two blazing torches line the entry way to the
bridge.  The lonely, swaying bridge is just inviting you to cross it.  To the west,
Fortish engraved arches lead to a mountain trail.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

374.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: The mountain side has many rock holds that make it easy to climb down from
here.  There is a large door above, leading to a giant stone platform that was
built into the mountain.  A long rope and wood bridge extends out from the
platform and seems to lead to another large mountain lying in the east.
Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your throat as you realize just
how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a line someone drew on
a sheet of paper.  To the east, Fortish arches lead to a large stone platform.

375.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side has many rock holds that make it easy to climb up and down
from here.  There is a large stone platform a little ways up the mountain.  A
long rope and wood bridge extends out from the platform and leads to another
large mountain lying to the far east.  As you climb the trail you see start to get
a better view of the magnificent marble bridge.  You can now see what looks like
people on the bridge, their heads just visible over the railings...  And there
looks to be a lot of them!  Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your
throat as you realize just how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like
a line someone drew on a sheet of paper.  Falling from here would be the last move
you ever make.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

376.name: Mountain road near Embattlements
desc: "   The wide mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north.  The
rope and wood bridge can be accessed with a short climb up from here.  It is much
too dangerous to climb the mountain in any other direction.  The bridge shifts and
sways slightly in the wind.  It looks very sturdy from here.  The bridge seems to
extend from this mountain to another mountain waiting in the northeast.  As you climb
the trail you see start to get a better view of the magnificent marble bridge.  You
can now see what looks like people on the bridge, their heads just visible over the
railings...  And there looks to be a lot of them! What could be over there?

377.name: Mountain road near Embattlements
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the south
and northwest.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  Following
the trail around to the mountain you can see the fine marble bridge leading to
Fortrum spanning an impossible gap.  The engineers of Fortrum are indeed masters
of the craft.  The view off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of
mountains fall into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone
rests in between the mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a
deadly fall off of the mountain from here.

378.name: Mountain road near Embattlements
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north
and southeast.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  Following
the trail around to the mountain you can see the fine marble bridge leading to
Fortrum spanning an impossible gap.  The engineers of Fortrum are indeed masters
of the craft.  The view off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of
mountains fall into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone
rests in between the mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a
deadly fall off of the mountain from here.

379.name: Mountain road near Embattlements
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the south
and northwest.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  The view
off the mountain is quite spectacular.  Following the trail around to the mountain
you can see the fine marble bridge leading to Fortrum spanning an impossible gap.
The engineers of Fortrum are indeed masters of the craft.  The range of mountains
fall into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a deadly fall
off of the mountain from here.

380.name: Mountain road near Embattlements
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the southeast.
The mountain can be climbed down from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and
climb in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of
mountains runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone
rests in between the mountains, connecting them all together.  Looking up into
the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the mountains together
and your climb up the steep trail keeps the marvel of the marble bridge in sight.
You quicken your pace, eager to see the wonders of Fortrum, the once closed
city...  There seems to be access to a bridge a little ways up the mountain.

381.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other directions.  You
could easily slip up and fall of the mountain side with the slightest misstep.
Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the
mountains together and your climb up the steep trail keeps the marvel of the
marble bridge in sight.  You quicken your pace, eager to see the wonders of
Fortrum, the once closed city.  A strong breeze whips across the mountain side,
trying to knock you from your perch and down to the rock valleys below.  The
green lustre of a forest is starting to come into view to the west.

382.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the west.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains
runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  As you round the mountain,
you see in the latice of bridges above a beautiful marble bridge spanning an
impossible gap from the blank walls of Fortrum, the mountain fortess.  At last,
your journey is nearing it's end.  There seems to be access to a bridge a little
ways up the mountain.

383.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the east and west.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open up to the north.
It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.  Looking up into
the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the mountains together.
The forest to the west of the mountain range is slowly fading into the distance.
The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain now seems to be a valley of
rock and stone.  Falling from the mountain now would surely mean certain death.

384.name: Mountain ledge near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the east and southwest.  The
mountain is too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open
up to the north.  It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the east.
Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the
mountains together.  The forest to the west of the mountain range is slowly
fading into the distance.  The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain
now is a valley of rock and stone.  Falling down the mountain from here would
surely mean certain death.

385.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the northeast and southwest.  The
mountain is too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open
up to the north.  It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.
Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the
mountains together.  The forest to the west of the mountain range is slowly
fading into the distance.  The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain
now is a valley of rock and stone.  Falling down the mountain from here would
surely mean certain death.

386.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the west and northeast.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open up to the north.
It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.  Looking up into
the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the mountains together.
The forest to the west of the mountain range is slowly fading into the distance.
The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain now seems to be a valley of
rock and stone.  Falling from the mountain now would surely mean certain death.

387.name: Mountain ledge near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the east and southwest.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The mountains open up to the north.
It appears that the mountains go out for miles to the northeast.  Looking up into
the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridges connecting the mountains together.
The forest to the west of the mountain range is slowly fading into the distance.
The only thing waiting at the bottom of the mountain now seems to be a valley of
rock and stone.  Falling from the mountain now would surely mean certain death.

388.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   There is a small mountain ledge leading to the northeast along the mountain side.
The mountain can be climbed down from here.  There is a large mountain range
coming into view to the northeast.  Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice
work of bridges connecting the mountains together.  The forest below the mountain
is getting further and further away.  It would not be a pleasant fall from here.

389.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues to the south.  The mountain side can be
climbed up from here.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  A strong wind blows across the mountain, almost knocking you from the
ledge.  The forest below is moving further and further away.  Falling from this
height would not be a great idea.  Looking up, the ragged mountain side does not
seem to come to an end.  The mountain pierces through the clouds in the sky,
hiding its peak.

390.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues to the north and southwest.  The mountain is
too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  There is a large mountain range
coming into view to the east.  It appears the mountains go out for miles to the
northeast.  Looking up into the sky, you can see a lattice work of bridge connecting
the mountains together.  The forest below the mountain is getting further and further
away.  It would not be a pleasant fall from here.

391.name: Mountain ledge near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge bends along the mountain side to the northeast and
southeast.  The rocky trail starts to crumble as you put your full weight onto
it.  You can see the tracks and scuff marks from previous travellers along this
trail.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other direction.
There is a large forest lying below the mountain to the west.  It appears as
though the forest stretches out for miles.

392.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the south and
northwest.  You can see the tracks and scuff marks from previous travellers along
the rocky trail.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other
direction.  There is a large forest lying to the west of the mountain range,
bordering the expansive, dusty plains to the south.  Some of the rock ledge begins
to crumble beneath your feet as you put the full weight of your body upon it.  It
is probably a good idea to stand around here for too long.

393.name: Mountain ledge near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north and
southeast.  You can see the tracks and scuff marks from previous travellers along
the rocky trail.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other
direction.  There is a large forest lying to the west of the mountain range,
bordering the expansive, dusty plains to the south.  Some of the rock ledge begins
to crumble beneath your feet as you put the full weight of your body upon it.  It
is probably a good idea to stand around here for too long.

394.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northwest
and southeast.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other
direction.  There is a large forest to the south of the mountain range, bordering
the expansive plains to the south.  *Clunk*  A small rock falls from the mountain
side and bonks you on the head.  That wasn't very nice.  The mountain ledge seems
to go on for quite a ways.

395.name: Mountain ledge near Ramparts
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the east and
northwest.  The mountain side is much too unstable to climb in any other direction.
There is a large forest to the south of the mountain range, bordering the expansive
plains to the west.  A strong breeze sweeps along side of the mountain, almost
knocking you off the ledge.  Better be careful.

396.name: Mountain road near Ramparts
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues to the west.  The ledge looks just wide enough
for one person to walk along.  The mountain side can be climbed down from here.
The mountain side is must too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  A strong
wind sweeping along side the mountain almost knocks you from the ledge.  The
ground below seems to be getting further and further away.  Looking up the
mountain, the prospect of this journey coming to an end is not approaching anytime
soon.  You better just keep moving.

397.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  You
could easily slip off and fall off the mountain side.  The forest slowly coming
into view to the west looks like a carpet of green from here.  The swaying trees
movement has all melded into one giant blanket of green.  The mountain's top
goes straight up into the clouds above.  This is going to be quite a climb.

398.name: Mountain road near Rampart
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the southeast.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  There are scuff marks along the mountain
trail from previous adventurers who tried to climb along the mountain side.  The
rocky plains below seem to stretch out for miles to the west and south.  There
is a large forest running along the border of the forest to the far west.  It seems
to end at the base of the mountains.  A strong breeze roads across the side of the
mountain, almost knocking you from the ledge.

399.name: Mountain ledge near Rampart
desc: "   The rugged mountain side continues to the east and northwest.  The mountain
is impossible to climb in any other direction, the rocks are too unstable.  A
small ledge seems to have formed to the northwest.  There are footprints left
from previous adventurers.  A strong breeze runs along side of the mountain.
It almost knocks you off the mountain side, better hold on tight.  Looking down
and out across the plains, you can see all the way to the forest's edge.  The
distance to the rocky floor below is becoming quite disorienting.  It would not
be a pleasant fall from here.

400.name: Mountain road near Rampart
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the east and
west.  The mountain is much to dangerous to climb in any other direction.  Some
of the ledge starts to crumble as you put your weight on it, better watch your
step.  There is a forest coming into view to the west.  The forest seems to
have been blocked at the cross section of the plains and mountain range.  The
rocky floor of the plains are lying below, waiting to catch you in the jagged
embrace with the slightest misstep.

401.name: Mountain road near Rampart
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the the west.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  There are scuff marks in the mountain
from previous adventurers who tried to climb along the mountain side.  The rocky
plains below seem to stretch out for miles to the south.  There is a forest
surrounding mountains to the west, bordering the plains.  A strong breeze roars
across the side of the mountain, almost knocking you from the ledge.

402.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rugged mountain side continues up and down.  There are plenty of hand
holds that make it easy to scale the mountain in either direction.  Unfortunately,
the mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  Looking
closely at the rocks you can see scuff marks left from previous adventurers.
The rocky plains so the south seem to meet the horizon.  A fall from this height
would be quite hazardous to your health, better hold on tight to the mountain.

403.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rugged mountain side continues up and down.  There are plenty of hand
holds that make it easy to scale the mountain in either direction.  Unfortunately,
the mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  Looking
closely at the rocks you can see scuff marks left from previous adventurers.
The rocky plains so the south seem to meet the horizon.  A fall from this height
would be quite hazardous to your health, better hold on tight to the mountain.

404.name: Mountain Road
desc: A small mountain trail continues to the east.  There are scuff marks all
along the trail from previous adventurers.  There is a large door above, leading
to a giant stone platform that was built into the mountain.  A long rope and wood
bridge extends out from the platform and seems to lead to another large mountain
lying in the west.  As you approach the marble bridge you start get a better view
of the entrance to Fortrum;  surrounded by a large wall it is mostly unadorned
except for a few battlements.  But the splendid gates are a beauty to behold,
even from this distance.  Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your
throat as you realize just how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a
line someone drew on a sheet of paper.  Falling from here would be the last move
you ever make.

405.name: Mountain Road
desc: The small mountain trail continues to the east and west.  Some of
the trail begins to crumble as you put your full weight onto it.  A large stone
platform is built into the mountain side a little further to the southwest.  It
looks like you maybe be able to get onto one of the bridges from there.  As you
approach the marble bridge you start get a better view of the entrance to Fortrum;
surrounded by a large wall it is mostly unadorned except for a few battlements.
But the splendid gates are a beauty to behold, even from this distance.  A strong
breeze sweeps across the mountain side, almost knocking you from the trail.
Looking off the mountain it is difficult to see the valleys below.  They look
like little lines drawn on a sheet of paper from here.  Falling from his height
would definitely not be good for your health.

406.name: Mountain Road
desc: The small mountain trail continues to the northeast and west.  Some of
the trail begins to crumble as you put your full weight onto it.  A large stone
platform is built into the mountain side a little further to the northeast.  It
looks like you maybe be able to get onto one of the bridges from there.  As you

But the splendid gates are a beauty to behold, even from this distance.  A strong

Looking off the mountain it is difficult to see the valleys below.  They look

would definitely not be good for your health.

407.name: Mountain Road
desc: "   The small mountain trail continues to the southwest and southeast.  There is
a large door above, leading to a giant stone platform that was built into the
mountain.  Two long rope and wood bridges extend out from the platform and seem
to be leading to large mountains waiting in the northeast and northwest.  To the
north-west, slightly obscured by a rope bridge, you can make out the gates of
Fortrum.  Rumour has it the gates are linked to the rope bridges via a marble
walkway that spans a hap of hundreds of feet--a sign to be seen and no mistake!
Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your throat as you realize just
how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a line someone drew on a sheet
of paper.  It would not be a good idea to jump off the mountain from here.

408.name: Mountain Trail

the trail begins to crumble as you put your full weight onto it.  A large stone
platform is built into the mountain side a little further to the northwest.  It

410.name: Mountain Trail
desc: A small mountain trail continues to the northwest.  There are scuff marks all
along the trail from previous adventurers.  There is a large door above, leading
to a giant stone platform that was built into the mountain.  A long rope and wood
bridge extends out from the platform and seems to lead to another large mountain
lying in the east.  To the north-west, slightly obscured by a rope bridge, you can
make out the gates of Fortrum.  Rumour has it the gates are linked to the rope
bridges via a marble walkway that spans a hap of hundreds of feet--a sign to be seen
and no mistake!  Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your throat
as you realize just how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a line
someone drew on a sheet of paper.  Falling from here would be the last move you
ever make.  To the east, Fortish engraved arches lead to a large stone platform.

411.name: On a Large Stone Platform
desc: The large stone platform juts out very unnaturally from the mountain.  It is
very sturdy but you cannot help but feel that it will slide down the mountain at
any moment.  A large door below the platform leads to a trail along the mountain
side.  Looking out across a rope and wood bridge to the east, you can see all
the way to the mountain it connects to on the other side.  Two blazing torches
line the entry way to the bridge.  The lonely, swaying bridge is just inviting
you to cross it.  To the west, Fortish engraved arches lead to a mountain trail.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

412.name: On a Large Stone Platform
desc: The large stone platform juts out very unnaturally from the mountain.  It is
very sturdy but you cannot help to feel that it will slide down the mountain at
any moment.  A large wooden door under the platform must allow for access to
climb on the mountain side.  Looking out across the rope and wood bridges to
the northeast and northwest, you can see all the way to the mountains they
connect to on the other sides.  Two blazing torches line the entry ways to the
bridges.  The lonely, swaying bridges are just inviting you to cross them.
To the south, Fortish engraved arches lead to another platform.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

413.name: Across a Swaying Rope Bridge
desc: "   The long rope bridge sways back and forth in the strong winds blowing between
the mountains.  The wooden walkway creaks beneath your feet as you put your full
weight down upon it.  The bridge looks very sturdy even though it has obviously
been around for decades.  Looking off the bridge and down into the valleys below,
it is apparent that a fall from here would be the end of your journey.  With
the forceful wind blowing across the bridge it would be a good idea to hold onto
the rope handrails, they run completely across the bridge.  A large stone
platform is built into the mountain at the end of the bridge to the west.  The.
rope and wood bridge continues east.

extra.desc: "   Thank goodness.  A stone platform!  All this swaying was gonna make you puke.
"   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

431.name: On a Large Stone Platform
desc: The large stone platform juts out very unnaturally from the mountain.
Here, a giant steel door is built into the mountain.  The door is engraved with
a large emblem of an upturned crescent moon with a dragon flying through it.
It appears to be the entrance to the Dragon Temple of Fortrum.
Looking out across the rope and wood bridges to the southwest and
northwest, you can see all the way to the mountains they connect to on the other
sides.  Two blazing torches line the entry way to the bridge.  The lonely,

461.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain trail continues to the northwest.  There are scuff marks all
along the trail from previous adventurers.  There is a large door above, leading
to a giant stone platform that was built into the mountain.  Long rope and wood
bridges extend out from the platform and seem to lead to even larger mountains
lying to the south.  Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your throat
as you realize just how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a
line someone drew on a sheet of paper.  Falling from here would be the last move
you ever make.

462.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The small mountain trail continues to the southeast and northwest.  Some of
the trail begins to crumble as you put your full weight onto it.  A large stone
platform is built into the mountain side a little further to the southeast.  It
looks like you maybe be able to get onto one of the bridges from there.  A strong
breeze sweeps across the mountain side, almost knocking you from the trail.
Looking off the mountain it is difficult to see the valleys below.  They look
like little lines drawn on a sheet of paper from here.  Falling from his height
would definitely not be good for your health.
