480.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side has many rock holds that make it easy to climb down from
here.  There is a large door above, leading to a giant stone platform that was
built into the mountain.  A long rope and wood bridge extends out from the
platform and seems to lead to another large mountain lying in the northeast.
Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your throat as you realize just
how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a line someone drew on
a sheet of paper.  Falling from here would be the last move you ever make.

481.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The wide mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the east.  The
rope and wood bridge can be accessed with a short climb up from here.  It is much
too dangerous to climb the mountain in any other direction.  The bridge shifts and
sways slightly in the wind.  It looks very sturdy from here.  The bridge seems to
extend from this mountain to another mountain waiting in the northeast.  What
could be over there?

482.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain ledge is widening as the access to the over head bridge looms into
sight.  The rocky ledge continues to the west and northeast.  It is much too
dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The valley below is getting harder to
see as you journey further up the mountain.  The view off the mountain is quite
breath taking from here.  The range of mountains fall into the horizon for quite
a ways to the north.

483.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the northeast
and southwest.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  The view
off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of mountains fall into the
horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in between the
mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a deadly fall off of
the mountain from here.

484.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the southwest.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains
runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  There is a lattice work of
bridges running in between the mountains also.  There seems to be access to a
bridge a little ways up the mountain.

485.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side continues to provide excellent climbing holds up and down.
Unfortunately, it is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.  You
could easily slip up and fall off the mountain side with the slightest misstep.
Long and rocky valleys run in between the mountain, connecting them together
like a map.  A strong breeze whips across the mountain side, better hold your
grip a little tighter.

486.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains
runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  There is a lattice work of
bridges running in between the mountains also.  There seems to be access to a
bridge a little ways up the mountain.

487.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the south
and northeast.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  The view
off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of mountains fall into the
horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in between the
mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a deadly fall off of
the mountain from here.

493.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rocky mountain side continues to provide excellent hand holds to climb
up and down.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other direction.
The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains runs into the horizon for
quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rest in between the mountains,
connecting them all together.  A strong wind gusts along the mountain side, almost
knocking you from your spot.  Better be careful.

494.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain trail continues along the mountain side to the west.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  The mountain is much too dangerous to
climb in any other direction.  A small clearing in the mountains is starting
to reveal itself directly below you.  You can see geysers of steam shoot out
from the ground in various places.  It is starting to get awfully warm here.
The breeze that usually runs between the mountains would feel really good
right now.

495.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain trail continues along the mountain side to the east.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  The mountain is much too dangerous to
climb in any other direction.  A small clearing in the mountains is starting

496.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rocky mountain side continues to provide excellent hand holds to climb

497.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The rocky mountain side continues to provide excellent hand holds to climb
up and down.  Even though the ground is not too far from here, you would
probably get quite injured by a fall from here.  A small clearing in the
mountains is opening up directly below you.  Geysers of steam and smoke billow
out of the ground every few minutes.  The temperature has increased at least
twenty degrees in the last few feet.

498.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain trail continues along the mountain side to the west.  The
mountain can be climbed up from here.  The mountain is much too dangerous to
climb in any other direction.  A small clearing in the mountains is starting
to reveal itself directly below you.  You can see geysers of steam shoot out
from the ground in various places.  It is starting to get awfully warm here.
The breeze that usually runs between the mountains would feel really good
right now.

499.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain trail continues along the mountain side to the east.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  The mountain is much too dangerous to
climb in any other direction.  A small clearing in the mountains is starting

from the ground in various places.  It is starting to get awfully warm here.
The breeze that usually runs between the mountains would feel really good
right now.

500.name: At the Base of the Mountain
desc: "   *WHOOSH*  A huge plume of hot air and smoke blows from the ground and into
your face.  The small clearing in the mountains, once deceivingly small, has
opened up into a large plain of lava plateaus.  The temperature down here is
insane.  You can feel the soles of your boots start to melt.  It would probably
be best just to climb back up the mountain.

501.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The wide mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the north.  The
rope and wood bridges can be accessed with a short climb up from here.  It is
much too dangerous to climb the mountain in any other direction.  The bridges
shift and sway every so slightly in the wind, but they appear to be very sturdy.
The rope and wooden bridges extend from the platform and reach out to other
mountains to the northeast and southeast.  Where are all these bridges leading to?

502.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain ledge is widening as the access to the over head bridges loom into
sight.  The rocky ledge continues to the south and northwest.  It is much too
dangerous to climb in any other direction.  The valley below is getting harder to
see as you journey further up the mountain.  The view off the mountain is quite
breath taking from here.  The range of mountains fall into the horizon for quite
a ways to the north.

extra.desc: "   The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

503.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the southeast.  The
mountain can be climbed down from here.  It is much too dangerous to try and climb
in any other directions.  The view from here is amazing.  The range of mountains
runs into the horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in
between the mountains, connecting them all together.  There is a lattice work of
bridges running in between the mountains also.  There seems to be access to a

505.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The small mountain ledge continues along the mountain side to the west
and southeast.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in any other
direction.  The rope and wood bridges are not too far up from here.  The view
off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The range of mountains fall into the
horizon for quite a ways.  The valleys of rock and stone rests in between the
mountains, connecting them all together.  It would be a deadly fall off of
the mountain from here.

506.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   A large cave has opened in the mountain to the south.  It is too dark in the
cave to see what is happening inside.  A small mountain ledge continues along
the mountain side to the east.  The mountain is much too dangerous to climb in
any other direction.  The view off the mountain is quite spectacular.  The
range of mountains fall into the horizon for quite some distance.  The valleys
of rock and stone rests in between the mountains, connecting them all together.
Falling off the mountain from this height would probably be the final mistake
you will ever make.

507.name: A Cave in the Mountain
desc: "   A large steel door blocks access to the mountain.  There must be something
awfully important behind it for such a formidable obstacle to be placed here.
What could it be?  You can go back out to the mountain side by entering the
trail.  It sure is peaceful in here.

508.name: Climbing the Mountain Side
desc: "   The mountain side has many rock holds that make it easy to climb down from
here.  There is a large door above, leading to a giant stone platform that was
built into the mountain.  Long rope and wood bridges extend out from the
platform and seem to lead to other mountains lying in the northeast and southeast.
Looking off the mountain, your breath catches in your throat as you realize just
how high up you are.  The valleys below just look like a line someone drew on
a sheet of paper.  Falling from here would be the last move you ever make.

509.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to the west.  The forest is much too dense
to continue any further to the south.  The vast and barren plains lie to the east
and north.  The forest is full of life.  You can see animals running and flying
all throughout the trees.  The fresh smell of the forest is refreshing and makes
you want to walk deeper into the trees.  The sunlight shines in through the tree
tops and leaves shadows of the shapes upon the forest floor.

510.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to the west, north and east.  The forest
is much too dense to continue any further to the south.  The expansive forest
is full of life.  You can see wild animals running and flying freely all
throughout the trees.  The fresh smell of the forest is refreshing and makes
you want to walk deeper into the trees.  The sunlight shines in through the
tree tops, leaving the shadowy shapes of branches and leaves on the forest floor.

533.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to the north and east.  There is a large
sand pit lying to the west and south of the forest's edge.  The trees lining
the edge of the forest are leaning away from the sand, as though they were
trying to grow away from something.  Looking into the sand, there does not
appear to be any life growing in there.  However, looks can be deceiving.

534.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to the north, east and south.  There is a
large sand pit lying to the west of the forest's edge.  The trees lining the
edge of the forest are leaning away from the sand, as though they were trying
to grow away from something.  Looking into the sand, you can see it slowly
shift and move, almost like it has a mind of its own.  It would probably be
best to stay out of there.

537.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to the north and east.  The forest is much
too dense to continue any further to the west.  There is a large sand pit lying
to the south of the forest's edge.  The trees lining the edge of the forest are
leaning away from the sand, as though they were trying to grow away from
something.  You can hear the moans and yelps of a trapped creature coming from
the south.  Looking into the sand, you can see a wild grizzly bear struggling
for its life.  The bear looks up to you in quiet desperation, as though it is
asking for help.  It would probably not offer you the same greeting if you were
to meet it in the forest.  It is probably best to just leave it alone and let
nature take its course.

walk deeper into the trees.  The sunlight shines down through the tree tops,
leaving the shadowy images of branches and leaves on the forest floor.

574.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues to the east, south and west.  A large farm
house sits on the top of a grass covered hill to the north.  Farm animals graze
in front of the farmhouse peacefully, as though they do not have a worry in the
world.  An old man dressed in blue overalls walks down the house's wooden porch
and heads to a small barn to the west of the house.  What could be in there?
The expansive forest is full of life.  You can see wild animals running and
flying freely all throughout the trees.

579.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The long and dusty plains open up to the west, south and north. A
plush, green forest flourishes here and grows out to the east. It is
strange that you could not see this from further away.  It must be some
sort of illusion created by the merciless sun and long, hill covered
plains.  The forest is unusually calm, even less wildlife than the
barren plains. It seems almost like someone is protecting this part
of the forest.

580.name: A Path Through the Forest
desc: "   The plush, green forest continues in every direction.  An odd sense of peace
washes over you as you walk through this section of the forest.  This area seems
to be completely peaceful.  There are no signs of life here, not even a bug on
the ground.  It feels almost like someone is protecting this part of the forest.

593.name: An Alcove in the Forest
desc: "   A small clearing surrounds a lake in the middle of the alcove.  A flowing
geyser of water playfully spouts out from the center of the lake, almost
inviting you to take a quick dip.  The surrounding forest seems to be completely
peaceful.  There are no signs of life here, not even a bug on the ground.
It feels almost like someone is protecting this part of the forest.  Was that
a sparkle coming from the bottom of the lake?

594.name: Fortish Lookout Tower
desc: "   If the embattlements are the first line of defense in Fortish Security, the lookout towers
essentially give them the power of clairvoyance. The Battlemasters and their soldiers would
know of any approaching threat well in advance, given the vantage point these towers have
over the mountain and valley.

595.name: Fortish Embattlement
desc: "   The Fortrum dwarves are very serious about the security of their empire. This
is one of a large number of embattlements which are scattered throughout this vast
mountain range. These fortified positions serve not only as a first line of defense
against invading forces, but also as a checkpoint to prevent against possible criminal
espionage. All visitors could be detained and searched at any given moment.

596.name: A Fortish Rampart
desc: "   You are standing on a Fortish rampart.  These thick stone defenses were built during
war between Fortrum and Terberthia many, many years ago.  Look!  You can even see some
evidence of the fighting in the long slashes and pits that mark the otherwise perfect
stone surfaces.  The dwarfs did good work building such sturdy defenses.

597.name: A Fortish Rampart
desc: "   You are standing on a Fortish rampart.  These thick stone defenses were built during

desc: "   You are standing on a Fortish rampart.  These thick stone defenses were built during

599.name: Fortish Embattlement
desc: "   This small embattlement is one of a great many which have been strategically placed
throughout this vast mountain range. The Forts are known for making defense a top
priority. This emphasis on security has served them well for many centuries.
